vidis.util.graphs.graph.algorithm
Class UnitCapacityNetworkFlow

java.lang.Object
  vidis.util.graphs.graph.algorithm.NetworkFlow
      vidis.util.graphs.graph.algorithm.UnitCapacityNetworkFlow
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class UnitCapacityNetworkFlow
extends NetworkFlow

Class that provides a flow on a 0-1-Network, i.e. a network with each of its edges having a flow of either 0 or 1. The capacity (i.e. the weight) of an edge is interpreted as 0 if it is 0 and interpreted as 1 otherwise. Having it this way we need not define a new class for unit capacity networks, but can use the regular Network classes here as well. The class provides an efficient algorithm derived from that of Dinic for finding a maximum flow.

Version:
1.0 2002-10-12
Author:
Ralf Vandenhouten
See Also:

Method Detail

maximizeFlow

public void maximizeFlow()
Method for finding a maximum flow in the network. The method uses the algorithm of Dinic by iteratively searching blocking flows in breadth-first search-tree residue networks.

Specified by:
maximizeFlow in class NetworkFlow

residueNetwork

public boolean residueNetwork()
Compute a residue network by a breadth-first search of paths from source to sink.

Returns:
Returns true if the breadth-first search finds a path to the sink, otherwise false.

blockingFlow

public void blockingFlow()
Compute a blocking flow by using findFlowPath() iteratively.
